messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full request path:
- /api/articles/{slug}/comments

All HTTP methods acceptable:
- false

Per-method allowed (based on the code):
- HEAD: false
- POST: true
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- The main router in hello.go creates a group v1 := r.Group("/api") and then calls:
  - v1.Use(users.AuthMiddleware(false))
  - articles.ArticlesAnonymousRegister(v1.Group("/articles"))
  - v1.Use(users.AuthMiddleware(true))
  - articles.ArticlesRegister(v1.Group("/articles"))
  Both ArticlesAnonymousRegister and ArticlesRegister operate on the /api + /articles group, so the effective prefix for routes declared in articles/routers.go is /api/articles.
- In articles/routers.go:
  - ArticlesAnonymousRegister registers router.GET("/:slug/comments", ArticleCommentList) — this establishes GET at /api/articles/:slug/comments (hence GET is allowed).
  - ArticlesRegister registers router.POST("/:slug/comments", ArticleCommentCreate) — this establishes POST at the same path /api/articles/:slug/comments (hence POST is allowed). Although this POST route is added under the later v1.Use(users.AuthMiddleware(true)) call (i.e., requires authentication), it still registers a POST handler for the same path in the code.
  - There is a DELETE route for comments, but it is DELETE("/:slug/comments/:id"), which is a different path (requires the extra {id} segment) and therefore does not make DELETE allowed for /api/articles/{slug}/comments.
- No router.Any or equivalent is used for that path, so "all methods" is false.
- Per the instructions, acceptance of HEAD/OPTIONS/others is determined solely from explicit registrations in code; there are no explicit HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, PUT, PATCH, or DELETE handlers for the exact path /api/articles/{slug}/comments, so those are false.
